fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.design

Interface IDesignService


  • @SystemService
public interface IDesignService
    Provides access to pages bound to record sources provided by a connector, and manages page designs.

    Registering instances of IPageSelector makes it possible to override the default behavior of:

    • getDashboard(ITicket)
    • getCreateFormPage(ITicket, ISource)
    • getUpdateFormPage(ITicket, IKey)
    • getListPage(IListView)
    • getListPages(ITicket)

    Note: implementations are permitted to defer persistence of design configuration changes for up to a second, to efficiently store a batch of changes. If the design configuration is externally updated when changes are pending (for example, by modifying a configuration file) then the deferred changes will be lost.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

      • DEFAULT_MAX_USER_DEFINED_PAGE_ITEM_COUNT

        static final int DEFAULT_MAX_USER_DEFINED_PAGE_ITEM_COUNT
        Defines the default maximum user-defined page item count value. This may be overridden with configuration options.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getMaximumUserDefinedPageItemCount(), Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getRouter

        IPageRouter getRouter()
        Gets the page router that defines and validates routes that dynamically select a resource based on attributes of a HTTP call.
        Returns:
        the page router.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getMaximumUserDefinedPageItemCount

        int getMaximumUserDefinedPageItemCount()
        Gets the maximum allowed page item count that can be specified using user-defined values.

        Note: this should be used internally by implementations of IPageRouter to sanitize user input and prevent abuse. It is not an absolute limit and is not enforced when using the API defined by this package (in other words, client application code is trusted, but values that may be provided by user input or by modifying URLs are not to be trusted; untrusted values should be compared with this value).

        Returns:
        a positive integer.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        DEFAULT_MAX_USER_DEFINED_PAGE_ITEM_COUNT

      • getPageGuards

        List<IPageGuard> getPageGuards()
        Gets the current list of page guards, that protect access to collections of pages and that can authenticate users.
        Returns:
        the list of page guards.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getDashboard

        IDashboardPage getDashboard(ITicket usingTicket)
        Gets the default dashboard page for a specified user.

        Note: the page context must not be set on returned instances when this method returns.

        Parameters:
        usingTicket - provides the context for the dashboard.
        Returns:
        the default dashboard page, or null if undefined.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getDashboardDesigns(), IPageSelector.selectDashboardPage(IDashboardPage, ITicket)

      • getListPages

        List<IListPage> getListPages(ITicket usingTicket)
        Gets the list of default list pages that are available for a specified user. The list will be built by querying all available connectors.

        Default values are selected for the list's filter and sort.

        Note: the page context must not be set on returned instances when this method returns.

        Parameters:
        usingTicket - provides the context for determing list contents.
        Returns:
        a list, possibly empty but never null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IDashboardPage.getPages(), getListDesigns(), IPageSelector.selectListPages(List, ITicket)

      • getListPages

        List<IListPage> getListPages(ITicket usingTicket,
                             IPlatformConnector connector)
        Gets the list of default list pages that are available for a specified user via a specified connector.

        Default values are selected for the list's filter and sort.

        Note: the page context must not be set on returned instances when this method returns.

        Parameters:
        usingTicket - provides the context for determing list contents.
        connector - non-null connector to use.
        Returns:
        a list, possibly empty but never null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IDashboardPage.getPages(), getListDesigns(), IPageSelector.selectListPages(List, ITicket)

      • getListPage

        IListPage getListPage(IListView forListView)
        Gets the specified list page for a specified list.

        Note: the page context must not be set on returned instances when this method returns.

        Parameters:
        forListView - the data list view, referring to a data source and a user, used to select the logical page representation.
        Returns:
        the logical page, or null if no corresponding page is available.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getListDesigns(), IPageSelector.selectListPage(IListPage, IListView)

      • getCreateFormPage

        IFormPage getCreateFormPage(ITicket usingTicket,
                            ISource forSource)
        Gets the specified form page for creating a new item for a specific source.

        Note: the page context must not be set on returned instances when this method returns.

        Parameters:
        usingTicket - the ticket authenticating the user requesting the page.
        forSource - the source for the item to create, used to select the logical page representation.
        Returns:
        the logical page, or null if no corresponding page is available.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getFormDesigns(), IPageSelector.selectCreateFormPage(IFormPage, ITicket, ISource)

      • getUpdateFormPage

        IFormPage getUpdateFormPage(ITicket usingTicket,
                            IKey forKey)
        Gets the specified form page for viewing and/or updating a specified item.

        Note: the page context must not be set on returned instances when this method returns.

        Parameters:
        usingTicket - the ticket authenticating the user requesting the page.
        forKey - the fetched or unfetched key, referring to a data source, used to select the logical page representation.
        Returns:
        the logical page, or null if no corresponding page is available.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getFormDesigns(), IPageSelector.selectUpdateFormPage(IFormPage, ITicket, IKey)

      • getDashboardDesigns

        List<IDashboardDesign> getDashboardDesigns()
        Gets all current dashboard page designs.

        Multiple designs can be provided, with a default selection being made using a consistent ranking algorithm. The default selection can be overridden by registering implementations of IPageSelector.

        Returns:
        a list of page designs, possibly empty, never null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getDashboardDesign(String), addDashboardDesign(String), removeDashboardDesign(String)

      • getDashboardDesign

        IDashboardDesign getDashboardDesign(String designName)
        Gets the named dashboard page design, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        designName - the non-null design name.
        Returns:
        the matching design, or null if not found.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getDashboardDesigns()

      • addDashboardDesign

        IDashboardDesign addDashboardDesign(String designName)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                    ConcurrentModificationException
        Adds and returns a new named dashboard page design.
        Parameters:
        designName - the non-null design name.
        Returns:
        the new named design.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if designName is not unique.
        ConcurrentModificationException - if the design configuration was externally updated when invoking this method.
        Since:
        1.0

      • removeDashboardDesign

        void removeDashboardDesign(String designName)
                    throws ConcurrentModificationException
        Removes the named dashboard page design. Does nothing if no design exists with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        designName - name of the page design to delete.
        Throws:
        ConcurrentModificationException - if the design configuration was externally updated when invoking this method.
        Since:
        1.0

        Returns:

        Since:
